column4: does anyone has an idea if it is possible to run a program that is using kde on my server that only uses command line with my local kubuntu ?
you can forward graphical programs over ssh via the option -X
how would i go about then to run ktorrent on my server?
ssh -X yourusername@yourserver, start ktorrent when logged in. the problem is, that logging out will kill ktorrent, and I don't know if you can use screen with an X program
the option is -X, not -x
you're startig it as root? probably that's the problem, because X access as root is disabled for security reasons
on many systems graphical access is disabled for root users for security reasons
a normal user not in root group also has the same problem
you checked if it works with an user which isn't in the root group?
does 'yes' mean you checked, or it works? if the latter, simply use a user which isn't in the root group, which is safer anyway
no problem, that's why i asked ;)
this is the error that i get : ERROR: KUniqueApplication: Can't determine DISPLAY. Aborting.
is the $DISPLAY environment variable set? do 'echo $DISPLAY', which will also give you the value of the variable
that just gives an emty line

perhaps it is better to start over: what i need is a working torrent client for seeding torrents. Rtorrent is seeding slowly or almost none. So i try to use ktorrent now. It is not the best solution to use it over ssh -X i guess. Perhaps u have better suggestions ?
so it's not set. that migt indicate that probably there's no X running on the machine. what output does 'ps -e|grep X' give?
sorry, was a bit slow
for your needs a non graphical torrent client seems to be ideal, tried any other than rtorrent? there's also a web based interface for bittorrent in the repos: torrentflux
torrentflux i have running but it will not start seeding either ...
you're sure it's a problem of the application? No firewall blocking any required ports?
sadly there are even some ISPs that block or slow down bittorrent traffic :(
i did apt-get remove iptables to be sure, and its a dedicated server so no blocking from isp :)
good luck then, I hope it will work then, but it's still weird that multiple different clients don't work
